/Users/daa/legacy/src/libpg/trunk/simulators/SP38/mergeProcessorOptimisatorOutput.py

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #! /usr/bin/python
00002 # This script will merge the outputs from paramics processor-cmd.exe and the RLAlg output.
00003 # It calcules the average vehicle count in the network and generate a new RLAlg output with this information.
00004 # Author: Tony Lopes (tony.lopes@gmail.com) (This is my first python program :-))
00005 # Date: 07/02/2006
00006 
00007 import os
00008 import sys
00009 import re
00010 
00011 # Transform one line of processor ouput in a tuple
00012 def decProcessorLine(line) :
00013     r = line.split()
00014     t = r[1].split(':')
00015     time, xrt, vehicles = ( int(t[0]), int(t[1]), int(t[2]) ), float(r[3]), int(r[6])
00016     return time, xrt, vehicles
00017 
00018 # Transform one line of optimisator output in a tuple
00019 def decOptimisatorLine(line) :
00020     r = line.split()
00021     steps, reward, maxparam, secs_run = int(r[1]), float(r[2]), float(r[3]), int(r[4])
00022     return steps, reward, maxparam, secs_run
00023 
00024 # usage information
00025 if len(sys.argv) < 6 :
00026     print 'usage: command <processor_output> <optimisator_output> <step_size> <step_duration> <merged_ouput>.'
00027     sys.exit()
00028 
00029 # Reading the files and arguments
00030 processor_lines = open(sys.argv[1], 'r').readlines()
00031 optimisator_lines = open(sys.argv[2], 'r').readlines()
00032 step_size = int(sys.argv[3])
00033 step_dur = int(sys.argv[4])
00034 merged_out = open(sys.argv[5], 'w')
00035 
00036 # Leaving only the intresting lines
00037 processor_lines = [ l for l in processor_lines if re.match("(^M:)|(^Paramics Simulator)",l) ]
00038 optimisator_lines = [ l for l in optimisator_lines if re.match("^Trial:",l) ]
00039 
00040 # Some error checks
00041 if len(processor_lines) == 0 :
00042     print 'Processor file do not has valid lines\n'
00043     sys.exit()
00044 
00045 if len(optimisator_lines) == 0 :
00046     print 'Optimisator file do not has valida lines\n'
00047     sys.exit()
00048 
00049 # Ooops, your step_size is different!
00050 if len(optimisator_lines) > 1 :
00051     s1 = decOptimisatorLine(optimisator_lines[0])[0]
00052     s2 = decOptimisatorLine(optimisator_lines[1])[0]
00053     if s2 - s1 != step_size :
00054         print "WARNING: You provided a step size different from the one in the optimisator output"
00055         step_size = s2 - s1
00056 
00057     
00058 merged = []             # This will hold the merged information
00059 ind_processor = 0       # The current line in processor output
00060 
00061 opt_run_ok = 1          # Holds if everyline of optimisator output was processed
00062 last_line = 0
00063 restarts = 0
00064 # For each step interval in optimisator output
00065 for i,line in enumerate(optimisator_lines) :
00066     steps, reward, maxparam, secs_run = decOptimisatorLine(line)
00067 
00068     tot_vehicles = 0
00069     minutes = 0
00070 
00071     if ind_processor == len(processor_lines) :
00072         opt_run_ok = 0
00073         last_line = i
00074         break
00075 
00076     # Counts the vehicles in the network
00077     # suposes the processor prints one line each minute
00078     started = 0
00079     while ind_processor < len(processor_lines) and (ind_processor-restarts)*60 < steps*step_dur + step_size*step_dur :
00080         line = processor_lines[ind_processor]
00081         if re.match("^Paramics Simulator",line) :
00082             started = 1
00083             restarts = restarts + 1
00084         else :
00085             proc = decProcessorLine(line)
00086             tot_vehicles = tot_vehicles + proc[2]
00087             minutes = minutes + 1
00088             
00089         ind_processor = ind_processor + 1
00090 
00091     # Calculates the average vehicles in the network for one optimisator interval
00092     avg_vehicles = tot_vehicles / minutes;
00093     # keep it to be printed
00094     merged.append ( (started, steps, reward, maxparam, secs_run, avg_vehicles) )
00095                                                 
00096 #Some useful information to see if the provided files are ok
00097 if ind_processor == len(processor_lines) and opt_run_ok == 1 :
00098     print "Every output merged"
00099 if ind_processor < len(processor_lines) :
00100     print "Did not process " + str(len(processor_lines)-ind_processor) + " lines from processor output"
00101 if opt_run_ok == 0 :
00102     print "Did not process " + str(len(optimisator_lines)-last_line) + " lines from optimisator output"
00103 
00104 #Now printing the merged output
00105 #the header
00106 merged_out.write( (7*" " + "Start".rjust(6) + "Steps".rjust(12) + "R".rjust(12) + "max(Param)".rjust(12) + "Seconds".rjust(12) + "Vehicles\n".rjust(13)) )
00107 for info in merged :
00108     #the information
00109     merged_out.write( "Trial: %6d %11d %11f %11f %11d %11d\n" % info)
00110 
00111 #some counts
00112 print "Processor outputs: ".ljust(30) + str(len(processor_lines)).rjust(10)
00113 print "Optimisator outputs: ".ljust(30) + str(len(optimisator_lines)).rjust(10)
00114 
00115 
00116 merged_out.close
